DataElement.preferredName: PET Imaging Signal Diffusion Topography Location Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text to describe the different topographical locations within the body by diffusion of PET imaging signal.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Positron Emission Tomography Imaging Signal Diffusion Topography Location
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered._The measured value of a response in a recorded image produced by the intensity, abundance, or concentration of source materials._The movement of chemical species under the influence of a concentration difference and as a result of random thermal agitation. The species will move from the high concentration area to the low concentration area till the concentration is uniform in the whole phase._The description of an anatomical region or of a body part._A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A noninvasive imaging method that provides information about cellular activity (metabolic information).  It is used along with magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) which provides information about the shape and size of the tumor (spatial information).

Concepts.definition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.

Property.preferredDefinition: The measured value of a response in a recorded image produced by the intensity, abundance, or concentration of source materials.:The movement of chemical species under the influence of a concentration difference and as a result of random thermal agitation. The species will move from the high concentration area to the low concentration area till the concentration is uniform in the whole phase.:The description of an anatomical region or of a body part.:A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

Concepts.definition: The measured value of a response in a recorded image produced by the intensity, abundance, or concentration of source materials.

The movement of chemical species under the influence of a concentration difference and as a result of random thermal agitation. The species will move from the high concentration area to the low concentration area till the concentration is uniform in the whole phase.
The description of an anatomical region or of a body part.
A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Abbreviated or shortened text field to describe an activity, topic, or item.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Description; a statement that represents something in words.:Having little (physical) length or seeming to be limited in (temporal) duration.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.
Having little (physical) length or seeming to be limited in (temporal) duration.
